subject: Re: [junit] Suggestion: New addition to the Assert class
msgSnippet: ... By doing so you just loose the most important information when you have to debug something: the stacktrace! simply add a throws Exception to the
messageBody:
> static public void fail(Exception e) {
> throw new AssertionFailedError(e.toString());
> }

By doing so you just loose the most important information when you have
to debug something: the stacktrace!

simply add a 'throws Exception' to the signature of your test method.

-Vladimir
